reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights in early July. It was warm outside and even hotter Inside. The hotel rooms are quite large and the beds comfortable but the ceilings are low and the lack of air con or other ventilation makes for a rather uncomfortable night's sleep. We were on the second floor and could open the window but it did make for more noise and smells from the kitchen chimney vent below! The Windows were frosted glass, so you couldn't see out of them anyway. The breakfast was fine and the staff correct. I found the hotel rather impersonal but probably good enough value for money. Good parking and internet connection. The fridge in the room was also a bonus. Excellent nearby restaurants!
reviews.title: An average stay in a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed Sunday night. We arrived around midday, too early to move into our room understandably though we checked in efficiently. We went out and returned later that evening to be given our room key. Room 210 I believe. Our room was very pokey and old fashioned but we decided that we'd stick with it as we were staying just for the one night.
reviews.title: Choose your room with care

reviews.text: We went out for the evening and returned to a very warm room. It wasn't practical to open the window as the hotel is by a road and very noisy. The was also lots of noise from the Resident lounge just down the corridor. Folks old enough to know better were incredibly loud on leaving the lounge.
reviews.title: A quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good if you liked a traditional English breakfast. Really good bacon and well cooked eggs. The 'Continental' option was little short of embarrassing with 5 'nuggets' of mixed cheese and some strange looking 'ham?'. The croissants were the cheapest, soggiest saddest croissants I've seen.
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff, especially those in the breakfast room were very friendly.
reviews.title: Romanesque

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights on Business in Jul 13. Great Hotel and Location.However, desperately needs aircon or some fan ventilation system as rooms and restaurant area too warm. I imagine rooms have been even worse with current heatwave. Great real ale selection and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a one night stay at this hotel and was given room number 231 and was not told that this is right next to a very busy highway We spent a very restless night with the sound of traffic Also when we had dinner the first night was greeted by one of the waiters who completely smelled of tobacco The hotel it self is just a short walk to town that is why we picked it but I don't think we will be returning
reviews.title: Noisy stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a two night stay here in July. The hotel is very central and on the canal. Our room was very clean and good size. We did take a while to work the television. We ate in the bar on our first night and the food was good. The second night we went on the evening Barge trip and it was excellent. The food was well presented and was far better than we expected. The staff were very attentive. We also had use of the pool sauna and steam room. This was included in the price along with the breakfast. If you are visiting Chester look at staying here
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal as there is free parking and yet it is only about a 10 minute walk to the Cathedral. Very good food in the restaurant and excellent service. It is a big hotel and we were in the "Annex" which meant that we had to walk over the bridge - except when visiting the Spa. Our room was a very good size and standard. When we could not get the TV to work properly, the engineer arrived within one minute (and got it working immediately) - very impressive! Reception very friendly and informative.
reviews.title: Friendly, professional and well located hotel

reviews.text: I stayed with a party of friends for the weekend. The hotel overall is too a very high standard, the staff in the hotel are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are very clean and nicely layed out. Great location to explore the city. Food was tasty and good valve for money. The real ale bar has a good selection of beers and they are well kept ed. The spa was lovely and a good place to relax.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: For a special celebration my wife and I together with 4 friends went for a luncheon canal cruise on the hotel barge. The food was simply excellent, the service friendly and very good and it was a very enjoyable experience at very good value. The three course lunch and coffee, including the cruise cost £18-50 per person.
reviews.title: Hidden Secret of Cheshire

reviews.text: The cruise is not exactly spectacular because it does not go very far (up two locks) but you see parts of Chester from a different perspective and we enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Nice Area - Average Hotel

reviews.text: This Hotel is located by the canal in a quite area. It is also 5 minutes walk away from the centre of Chester. The Spa and pool are kept tidy and service is good but unfortunately I cannot say the same for the rooms, at least the one we were given. The breakfast was good and they also provide vegetarian options. We used to have dinner at the Hotel's Pub which was very good. The parking at the hotel is free but it was open to the general public(at a charge) so sometimes it is hard to find a space
reviews.title: Excellent, matched expectation.
Excellent location
reviews.text: Great location and a good gym. Located within easy walking distance of the city centre and next to the canal where various good bars are situated. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable and we enjoyed the smoked haddock at breakfast

reviews.title: Very good hotel in a convenient position
reviews.text: I travelled with my partner and stayed here for one night. The hotel itself has free on site parking and is only a 10 minute walk into Chester. Our room was in the annexe over the bridge and facing the canal which was lovely, very quiet. The hotel has good facilities and the health club and pool were a welcome addition. Overall a well priced hotel in a central location. We have stayed in Chester on numerous occasions and would certainly visit this hotel again. The staff were pleasant and the breakfast was good. Great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 3 night stay in the hotel which we thoroughly enjoyed. We found the staff extremely courteous and helpful whether it be at the reception, the bar or in the restaurant. However, a special mention to the staff aboard the hotel's canal cruiser which we dined on one evening as the food and service were excellent. We paid for an upgraded Executive room which was a decent size and was very clean although only slight downside was the temperature in the evening which was very warm and a bit uncomfortable. As our room faced the main road, it was fairly noisy so opening the window was not ideal. We didn't use the exercise facilities although the pool area looked good and the gym well stocked with machines. Overall, we were very happy with our choice of hotel and wouldn't hesitate to book again when next visiting Chester.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 days while catching up with friends.
reviews.title: nice and central

reviews.text: The hotel was clean but basic and we had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and welcoming but the check in procedure was a bit automated (maybe the receptionist had had a busy day)
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: We didn't make use of the leisure facilities on offer on this visit
reviews.title: Great hotel bar, and place to stay
